meanings.definition: Expressing or involving condemnation or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: Her reprobatory glare made him realize he had made a mistake.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's reprobatory tone indicated that she was not pleased with the students' behavior.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a reprobatory look when it saw the mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky had a reprobatory feel, warning of an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The judge's reprobatory words echoed in the courtroom, silencing the spectators.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or showing disapproval or condemnation.
meanings.sent1: His reprobatory expression revealed his dissatisfaction with the situation.
meanings.sent2: The principal's reprobatory comments were aimed at improving student behavior.
meanings.sent3: The reprobatory cat refused to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a reprobatory air about it, as if it disapproved of any changes.
meanings.sent5: The reprobatory look from her mother made her rethink her actions.
